Reason: The 'table_count_warn_threshold' configuration does not involve any performance-related operations that are time-extensive or memory-extensive within its related code. The configuration simply checks the number of tables in the cluster against a threshold and logs a warning message if it exceeds the threshold. This operation is not time-expensive or memory-expensive and does not lead to notable performance variations at the system level. Therefore, the configuration is not considered performance-sensitive.
